Class AddProductController

java.lang.Object
com.example.software_1_project.AddProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddProductController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class adds Product data.

      public AddProductController()

  • Method Details

    • backToMainForm

      public void backToMainForm(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method returns the user back to the "Main Form" scene.
      Parameters:
      event - is the action event which is executed when the user clicks the "Cancel" button in the "Add Product Form" scene.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • OnSaveAddProduct

      public void OnSaveAddProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method adds a new product based on the user added data.
      Parameters:
      event - is the action event which is executed when the user clicks the "Save" button in the "Add Product Form" scene. Once the user inputs the valid data and clicks the "Save" button, the scene will be switched back to the "Main Form" scene, and the Product table will be populated with the information of the added product. A dialogue box will appear for all invalid data entries.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • OnAddAssociatedPart

      public void OnAddAssociatedPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method assigns a part to a product.
      Parameters:
      event - is the action event which is executed when the user clicks the "Add" button in the "Add Product Form" scene. Once the user selects a respective part from the "Part" table and clicks the "Add" button, the selected part is added to "Associated Part" table. If the "Add" button is clicked without selecting the part, Error dialogue box will appear.

    • OnRemoveAssociatedPart

      public void OnRemoveAssociatedPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method removes the selected part from the "Associated Part" table.
      Parameters:
      event - is the action event which is executed when the user clicks the "Remove Associated Part" button in the "Add Product Form" scene. Once the user selects a respective part from the "Associated Part" table and clicks the "Remove Associated Part" button, the selected part is removed. If the "Remove Associated Part" button is clicked without selecting a part, Error dialogue box will appear.

    • searchPartByNameOrId

      public void searchPartByNameOrId(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method searches the data from the Part table based on the "Part ID" or partial/full "Part Name" entered by the user, and provides the search results.
      Parameters:
      event - is the action event which is executed when the user types keyword in the search "Text Field" in the "Add Product Form" and presses the "Enter" button on the keyboard. Matching search results appear If search founds no results, a Warning dialogue box appears.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes the "AddProductController" class. Whenever user accesses the "Add Product Form" scene, the "Part Table" will be pre-populated with the part data.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
